channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid 19: What happened in New Zealand on 22 April
item.description: Another Rosewood rest home resident has died, data shows Kiwis are mostly abiding the rules, and a DHB blames a PPE breach for Covid-19 infections among staff.

item.title: Pharmac back-tracks on plan to fund lung cancer drug Keytruda
item.description: The drug agency says budget pressures caused by Covid-19 have forced it to freeze plans to fund a drug that would have helped at least 1400 cancer patients a year.

item.title: Fast food outlets get ready for flood of customers
item.description: The race for fast food and delivery chains to get ready in time for Tuesday's rush is on - each store putting the work in to get their fridges fully stocked, and their deliveries up and running.

item.title: PM rejects comments by MPs on small business
item.description: The Prime Minister has distanced herself from comments made by two of her MPs about small business owners, saying she disagrees with them.

item.title: Covid-19: Whānau relying on hunting for food should have exemption - leaders
item.description: Māori leaders are backing calls for the government to lift the ban on hunting during alert level three, but only to whānau who rely on it to feed themselves.

item.title: Man charged with murder after death at Auckland brothel
item.description: Police have charged a 60-year-old man with murder over the death of Zion Gutnik, whose body was found at an Auckland brothel last month.

item.title: GPs fear for jobs, midwives feel ignored from government support
item.description: Community healthcare providers say they are being shortchanged during the Covid-19 crisis, and it'll be services that suffer.

item.title: As it happened: Live updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: Air New Zealand has confirmed that 30 of its staff have tested positive for Covid-19, with 25 of them now recovered. See how the rest of the day's developments unfolded with RNZ's blog.

item.title: Covid-19: Longterm casual council staff going without pay
item.description: Casual workers at council facilities have been left without an income despite many working regular hours for a number of years.

item.title: Forty percent of Pasifika people in crowded housing
item.description: Nearly 40 percent of Pacific people are living in overcrowded houses, according to data just released from the 2018 census.

item.title: Covid-19: Zero international arrivals marks low point for tourism
item.description: No international passengers will arrive in New Zealand today for the first time in decades. Tourism heads say the only way is up.

item.title: Christchurch City Council boss to take 10 percent pay cut
item.description: Christchurch City Council chief executive Dawn Baxendale says she will take a 10 percent pay cut for the 2020-21 financial year.

item.title: Six new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, one more death
item.description: Six new cases of Covid-19 have been reported in the past 24 hours in New Zealand, with one more death confirmed.

item.title: Covid-19: Health Ministry cautious over reports of re-infection
item.description: The Health Ministry has no plans to routinely re-test people for Covid-19 after they have recovered from the virus.

item.title: More money set aside by government to help welfare and food needs
item.description: The government has approved a further $30 million to help meet immediate welfare and food needs due to Covid-19.

item.title: Bubble-bound: Data shows most people obeying rules
item.description: Global data collected by Google shows most New Zealanders are continuing to abide by level 4 restrictions, despite an increase in lockdown breaches and convictions.

item.title: Dunedin's Royal Albatross family: Waiting for a father's return
item.description: The Royal Albatross family on Dunedin's Tairoa Head, watched by more than 180,000 people around the world, has been reunited after an anxious month.

item.title: Man barricades himself inside Auckland house after threatening police
item.description: A situation where a man was in a stand-off with police after barricading himself inside a house in the Auckland suburb of Flat Bush has been resolved.
